thread.title: A-Rod throws football through TV in first talking-head stunt
thread.title_full: A-Rod throws football through TV in first talking-head stunt | New York Post

author: Jonathan Lehman
title: A-Rod throws football through TV in first talking-head stunt
text:
Alex Rodriguez wasted no time wreaking destruction in his new moonlighting gig at Fox Sports.
The divisive Yankees slugger signed on as a talking head for the MLB postseason , set to debut before Monday’s Game 3 of the ALCS between the Blue Jays and Royals.
He was unveiled during the football studio show Sunday morning, chumming around with new colleagues Michael Strahan, Jimmy Johnson, Terry Bradshaw and approximately seven other guys. He said he was psyched for Patriots-Colts (or, as Rodriguez boiled it down, Tom Brady vs. Frank Gore) and Seahawks-Panthers.
Rodriguez played some quarterback during high school, so the show’s producers wound him up to throw a football to reporter Jay Glazer, positioned across the studio. Even Chase Headley thought that was an overthrow .
Watch the whole segment here:
Announcing the newest member of the @MLBonFOX #postseason crew: Alex Rodriguez! 

 @AROD discusses on FOX NFL Sunday http://t.co/WttZz9l18W 
— FOX Sports (@FOXSports) October 18, 2015 

  alex rodriguez ,  fox sports
